alert.note: Alert for Cherokee; Mayes; Wagoner (Oklahoma) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 14 at 12:41AM CDT by NWS Tulsa
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of southern Rogers, southwestern Mayes, central Wagoner, northern Cherokee and east central Tulsa Counties through 115 AM CDT... At 1241 AM CDT, Doppler radar indicated strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 2 miles southeast of Tulsa International Airport to 7 miles northwest of Hulbert. Movement was east at 15 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down small tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations in or near the path include... Tulsa... Broken Arrow... Claremore... Wagoner... Owasso... Catoosa... Verdigris... Chouteau... Inola... Hulbert... Peggs... Tulsa International Airport... Taiwah... Tiawah... Turley... Mazie... Lost City... Murphy... This includes Interstate 44 between mile markers 228 and 254. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with these storms. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
